dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 6211 IH: Safeguarding Americans From Extremism Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Zinke (for himself, Mr. Harris, Mr. Bean of Florida, Mr. Norman, Mr. DesJarlais, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Posey, Mr. Moore of Alabama, Mr. Biggs, and Ms. Greene of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security or the Secretary of State, as applicable, from approving any application for or issuing a nonimmigrant or immigrant visa to nationals of Palestine.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safeguarding Americans From Extremism Act of 2023 or the SAFE Act of 2023.

section.header: Prohibition on issuing certain visas to nationals of Palestine

subsection.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security may not grant a covered alien temporary protected status in the United States pursuant to section 244 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1254a).

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security and the Secretary of State may not approve any application for or issue a nonimmigrant or immigrant visa, as applicable, to a covered alien.
The Secretary of Homeland Security shall revoke any nonimmigrant or immigrant visa issued to a covered alien on or after October 1, 2023.

The Secretary of Homeland Security or the Attorney General may not grant asylum to a covered alien who has applied for asylum in accordance with section 208 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1158).
The Secretary of Homeland Security shall revoke a covered alien’s status as an asylee if such status was applied for on or after October 1, 2023.
The Secretary of Homeland Security may not grant admission as a refugee to a covered alien.
The Secretary of Homeland Security shall revoke a covered alien’s status as a refugee if such status was applied for on or after October 1, 2023.
The Secretary of Homeland Security may not parole into the United States a covered alien.
The Secretary of Homeland Security shall revoke a covered alien’s parole if such alien was paroled into the United States on or after October 1, 2023.

subsection.text: A covered alien shall be inadmissible to the United States.

Beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Homeland Security, in coordination with the Director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement and the Director of U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services, shall promptly identify covered aliens who do not have lawful status under the immigration laws (as such term is defined in section 101 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1101)) and take such steps as necessary to remove such aliens.
In this section, the term covered alien means an alien who is a holder of a passport or other travel document issued by the Palestinian Authority.
